A Psalm of David<S>1732</S>, Maschil<S>4905</S>. Blessed<S>835</S> is he whose transgression<S>6588</S> is forgiven<S>5375</S>, whose sin<S>2401</S> is covered<S>3680</S>. <sup>A Psalm: or, A Psalm of David giving instruction</sup>
Blessed<S>835</S> is the man<S>120</S> unto whom the LORD<S>3068</S> imputeth<S>2803</S> not iniquity<S>5771</S>, and in whose spirit<S>7307</S> there is no guile<S>7423</S>.
When I kept silence<S>2790</S>, my bones<S>6106</S> waxed old<S>1086</S> through my roaring<S>7581</S> all the day<S>3117</S> long.
For day<S>3119</S> and night<S>3915</S> thy hand<S>3027</S> was heavy<S>3513</S> upon me: my moisture<S>3955</S> is turned<S>2015</S> into the drought<S>2725</S> of summer<S>7019</S>. Selah<S>5542</S>.
I acknowledged<S>3045</S> my sin<S>2403</S> unto thee, and mine iniquity<S>5771</S> have I not hid<S>3680</S>. I said<S>559</S>, I will confess<S>3034</S> my transgressions<S>6588</S> unto the LORD<S>3068</S>; and thou forgavest<S>5375</S> the iniquity<S>5771</S> of my sin<S>2403</S>. Selah<S>5542</S>.
For this shall every one that is godly<S>2623</S> pray<S>6419</S> unto thee in a time<S>6256</S> when thou mayest be found<S>4672</S>: surely in the floods<S>7858</S> of great<S>7227</S> waters<S>4325</S> they shall not come nigh<S>5060</S> unto him. <sup>when: Heb. of finding</sup>
Thou art my hiding place<S>5643</S>; thou shalt preserve<S>5341</S> me from trouble<S>6862</S>; thou shalt compass<S>5437</S> me about with songs<S>7438</S> of deliverance<S>6405</S>. Selah<S>5542</S>.
I will instruct<S>7919</S> thee and teach<S>3384</S> thee in the way<S>1870</S> which<S>2098</S> thou shalt go<S>3212</S>: I will guide<S>3289</S> thee with mine eye<S>5869</S>. <sup>guide: Heb. counsel thee, mine eye shall be upon thee</sup>
Be ye not as the horse<S>5483</S>, or as the mule<S>6505</S>, which have no understanding<S>995</S>: whose mouth<S>5716</S> must be held<S>1102</S> in with bit<S>4964</S> and bridle<S>7448</S>, lest<S>1077</S> they come near<S>7126</S> unto thee.
Many<S>7227</S> sorrows<S>4341</S> shall be to the wicked<S>7563</S>: but he that trusteth<S>982</S> in the LORD<S>3068</S>, mercy<S>2617</S> shall compass<S>5437</S> him about.
Be glad<S>8055</S> in the LORD<S>3068</S>, and rejoice<S>1523</S>, ye righteous<S>6662</S>: and shout<S>7442</S> for joy, all ye that are upright<S>3477</S> in heart<S>3820</S>.
